hanzi-su-wiki:
傷

Значения

Рана, ушиб; дефект; болеть, причинять боль; повреждать, портить

Мнемоника

Когда стрелы затмевают лучи (снизу справа) солнца 日, человеку 亻 уцелеть нелегко.

Варианты

伤

shāng
to injure; injury; wound
ранить; травма, повреждение; ранить

傷心 [ shāng xīn ]: to grieve; to be broken-hearted; to feel deeply hurt

heisig_chinese_memo: Mr. T reclines while enjoying the sun but he doesn't see his piggy bank underneath him and wounds it.&nbsp
heisig_constituent: wound, person, reclining, lying down, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets
Keyword_KANJIDIC: wound, hurt, injure, impair, pain, injury, cut, gash, scar, weak point
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: рана, боль, ранить, отрицательно влияет, боль, травмы, вырезать, рана, рубец, слабое место
koohiiStory1: If someone doesn't have a fat piggy bank to cover their medical costs and happen to get wounded somewhere, they'll be reclining there forever.
koohiiStory2: Mr. T gets wounded by reclining on his piggy bank.
jp_example_words:
火傷(かしょう): burn, scald
傷付く(きずつく): to be hurt, to be wounded, to get injured
傷(しょう): wound, injury, hurt, cut, gash, bruise, scratch, scar, weak point
中傷(ちゅうしょう): slander, libel, defamation
負傷(ふしょう): injury, wound
傷(きず): wound, injury, hurt, cut, gash, bruise, scratch, scar, weak point
火傷(やけど): burn, scald
jp_readingExamples: 傷む (いた.む), 傷める (いた.める), 傷 (きず)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If a leader has a gun it's easy to wound people. When you have a gun and a lot of responsibility it's easy to get carried away and mess up, wounding the people you were supposed to be protecting. You can even wound yourself.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture how easy it would be for the leader of your country to wound someone if they had a gun. Scary, right?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Which leader wounded the Japanese people? The Shougun (しょう). The Shougun is a military leader. The Shougun even has gun in the name. And they wounded hundreds of thousands of samurai and soldiers.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the Shougun you've slowly grown to know over the last thirty-ish levels. But he's holding a gun wounding everyone around him. He's screaming and shooting and wounding everyone in sight. Even his mom, even his dog, even his farmers.
Ru_Meaning: wound, hurt, injure, impair, pain, injury, cut, gash, scar, weak point
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ノ, 化 (превращаться), 日 (день), 勿 (конечно)
Ru_trainchinese:
shāng: (сущ/глаг) травма, рана; ранить; приедаться, надоедать (обычно о еде)
shāng: (графема) печалиться; заболевать; вредить, затруднять
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (亻) and the glorious (昜) man (𠂉) are wounded
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When Mr. T wounds a muscle he lies down and reclines.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " person ", " 𥏻 " to save the sound, the original meaning is trauma. "Shuowen": "Chuangye. From the people, 𥏻 save the sound." "Shuo Mingshang": "If you look down on the ground, you can hurt your feet."

" Injury " can mean injury or damage. "Xunzi·Wang Ba": "Who is the one who hurts the country?" Says: "It is a catastrophe that hurts the country by admiring the people by the villain, and by coincidence with the people by not taking it.""

" Injury " can also mean slander or slander. "Lu Shichunqiu‧ Chawei": "Bao Zhaobo was angry and hurt Zhaogong." Gao You's note: "The injury is still slanderous."

" Injury " also means obstruction. "The Analects of Confucius: Advanced": "What hurts it? Each has its own ambition."

" Hurt " also means worry and sadness. "Poetry. Zhou Nan. Volume Ears": "I will not be hurt forever if I take care of him."

" Injury " also means a funeral sacrifice. "Guan Zi‧ Under the Ruler": "Ming Jun decorated the ceremony of eating, drinking and hanging injuries." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Injury is a funeral sacrifice."
humanum_short_description_en: From " person ", " 𥏻 " to save the sound, the original meaning is trauma.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，「𥏻」省聲，本義為創傷。《說文》：「創也。从人，𥏻省聲。」 《書‧說命上》：「若跣弗視地，厥足用傷。」

　　「傷」可表示傷害、損害。《荀子‧王霸》：「傷國者何也？曰：『以小人尚民而威，以非所取於民而巧，是傷國之大災也。』」

　　「傷」也可表示中傷、詆毀。《呂氏春秋‧察微》：「郈昭伯怒，傷之於昭公。」高誘注：「傷猶譖也。」

　　「傷」也表示妨礙。《論語‧先進》：「何傷乎？亦各言其志也。」

　　「傷」還表示憂思、悲傷。《詩‧周南‧卷耳》：「我姑酌彼兕觥，維以不永傷。」

　　「傷」亦表示喪祭。《管子‧君臣下》：「明君飾食飲弔傷之禮。」尹知章注：「傷謂喪祭也。」

①受損壞的地方：工傷。傷痕。
②損害：傷了筋骨。傷腦筋。傷神。勞民傷財。
③因某種致病因素而得病：傷風。傷寒。
④因過度而感到厭煩：傷食。
⑤妨礙：無傷大體。
⑥悲哀：悲傷。哀傷。神傷。感傷。傷悼。傷逝(悲傷地懷念去世的人)。
⑦得罪：傷衆。開口傷人。

從「 人 」，「 𥏻 」省聲，本義為創傷。《說文》：「創也。从人，𥏻省聲。」 《書‧說命上》：「若跣弗視地，厥足用傷。」 「 傷 」可表示傷害、損害。《荀子‧王霸》：「傷國者何也？曰：『以小人尚民而威，以非所取於民而巧，是傷國之大災也。』」 「 傷 」也可表示中傷、詆毀。《呂氏春秋‧察微》：「郈昭伯怒，傷之於昭公。」高誘注：「傷猶譖也。」 「 傷 」也表示妨礙。《論語‧先進》：「何傷乎？亦各言其志也。」 「 傷 」還表示憂思、悲傷。《詩‧周南‧卷耳》：「我姑酌彼兕觥，維以不永傷。」 「 傷 」亦表示喪祭。《管子‧君臣下》：「明君飾食飲弔傷之禮。」尹知章注：「傷謂喪祭也。」
From " person", " 𥏻" to save the sound, the original meaning is trauma. "Shuowen": "Chuangye. From the people, 𥏻 save the sound." "Shuo Mingshang": "If you look down on the ground, you can hurt your feet." " Injury" can mean injury or damage. "Xunzi·Wang Ba": "Who is the one who hurts the country?" Says: "It is a catastrophe that hurts the country by admiring the people by the villain, and by coincidence with the people by not taking it."" " Injury" can also mean slander or slander. "Lu Shichunqiu‧ Chawei": "Bao Zhaobo was angry and hurt Zhaogong." Gao You's note: "The injury is still slanderous." " Injury" also means obstruction. "The Analects of Confucius: Advanced": "What hurts it? Each has its own ambition." " Hurt" also means worry and sadness. "Poetry. Zhou Nan. Volume Ears": "I will not be hurt forever if I take care of him." " Injury" also means a funeral sacrifice. "Guan Zi‧ Under the Ruler": "Ming Jun decorated the ceremony of eating, drinking and hanging injuries." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Injury is a funeral sacrifice."

傷字的基本解释

傷
shāng
见“伤”。

傷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shāng］
［《廣韻》式羊切，平陽，書。］
“伤1”的繁体字。
(1)创伤。
(2)特指创伤之浅者。
(3)伤害，损害。
(4)中伤，诋毁。
(5)妨碍。
(6)忧思，悲伤。
(7)哀悼，哀怜。
(8)丧祭。
(9)指吊丧主。
(10)嫌，失之于。
(11)太，过度。
(12)因过度而不能忍受或不能继续。
(13)姓。春秋宋有伤省。

傷字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　傷； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页115第01
【唐韻】式羊切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】尸羊切，?音商。痛也。【爾雅·釋詁】傷思也。【詩·周南】維以不永傷。【小雅】我心憂傷。　又創也，損也。【書·說命】若跣弗視地，厥足用傷。　又毀傷也。【禮·緇衣】心以體全，亦以體傷。　又戕害也。【左傳·僖二十二年】君子不重傷。　又姓。【左傳】傷省，宋人。　又【諡法】未家短折曰傷。　又叶式亮切，同慯。【張衡·四愁詩】路遠莫致倚愁悵，何爲懷憂心煩傷。

考證：〔【爾雅·釋訓】憂思也。〕　謹照原文釋訓改釋詁，憂思也改傷思也。〔【書·說命】若跣勿視地。〕　謹照原文勿視改弗視。
傷字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
傷字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
hurt
shāng
See "Injury".
hurt
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shāng］
["Guangyun" style sheep cut, Pingyang, book. ]
Traditional characters of "伤1".
(1) Trauma.
(2) Especially refers to those with shallow trauma.
(3) Injury, damage.
(4) Defamation and slander.
(5) Obstacle.
(6) Worry, sadness.
(7) Mourning, pity.
(8) Funeral sacrifice.
(9) Refers to mourning the lord.
(10) Suspicious, lost.
(11) Too, excessive.
(12) Unbearable or unable to continue due to excessiveness.
(13) Last name. Spring, Autumn and Song are hurting provinces.
hurt
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　伤; Kangxi strokes: 13; Page number: page 115 01
[Tang Yun] Style Sheep Cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Corpse Sheep Cut, Sound Quotient. It hurts too. 【Erya·Shigu】Sorrowful thinking. [Poetry·Zhou Nan] Wei Yi will not be hurt forever. [Xiaoya] My heart is sad.　 Create again, damage too. 【Book·Fate】If you look at the ground, you will hurt your feet.　It's hurting again. 【Rite·Clothes】The heart is full of body, but also physical injury.　It's also hurting again. [Zuo Zhuan·Xi Twenty-two Years] The gentleman is not seriously injured.　Another last name. [Zuo Zhuan] Injured the province, Song people.　 [posthumous posthumous] Weijia said short-term injury.　The leaves are brightly cut, the same. [Zhang Heng·Four Sorrows Poems] Lu Yuan is not sorrowful, so what is sadness and sadness. Textual research: [[Erya·Shixun] Worry and thinking. 〕 　 I would like to interpret the exegesis according to the original text, and change the thoughts of worry to the thoughts of sadness. 〔【Book·Fate】Don't look at the ground. 〕 　 I would like to follow the original text and do not change it.

Name meaning

shāng
вм. 伤
Radicals: ｲ, 易  (leader, easy, gun)
Meaning Mnemonic
If a leader has a gun it's easy to wound people. When you have a gun and a lot of responsibility it's easy to get carried away and mess up, wounding the people you were supposed to be protecting. You can even wound yourself.
Picture how easy it would be for the leader of your country to wound someone if they had a gun. Scary, right?
Reading Mnemonic
Which leader wounded the Japanese people? The Shougun (しょう). The Shougun is a military leader. The Shougun even has gun in the name. And they wounded hundreds of thousands of samurai and soldiers.
Picture the Shougun you've slowly grown to know over the last thirty-ish levels. But he's holding a gun wounding everyone around him. He's screaming and shooting and wounding everyone in sight. Even his mom, even his dog, even his farmers.
